## Title

(feat/fix/chore/docs(scope): Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above)

**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (Delete this section before submitting PR):**

- Make sure you have done your changes in a separate branch. Branches MUST have descriptive names that start with either the `fix/` or `feature/` prefixes. Good examples are: `fix/signin-issue` or `feature/issue-templates`.
- Your pull request MUST NOT target the `master` or `staging` branch on this repository. You probably want to target `develop` instead.
- Give a descriptive title to your PR with type(scope). Follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) format.
- Put `closes #XXXX` in your comment to auto-close the issue that your PR fixes (if such).

<!--- Describe your changes in short summary. -->

## Context / Proposed changes
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
